Package view

Class ProgramView

java.lang.Object
view.ProgramView
public class ProgramView extends Object
The ProgramView class is responsible for managing all view components of the program. All controller/view interactions should be done through an instance of this class. References: 1. Morelli, Ralph. Java, Java, Java. 3rd ed., Prentice Hall, 2006. 2. “How to Use Key Bindings.” Oracle Java Documentation, https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/uiswing/misc/keybinding.html. Accessed 8 Dec. 2023.
Version:
1.0a
Author:
Charlie Herbert

  • Constructor Details

    • ProgramView

      public ProgramView()
      Creates a new ProgramView object. Initializes all UI elements necessary for the program, however a graph still must be assigned.

  • Method Details

    • getFrame

      public JFrame getFrame()
      Returns the main frame of this view. Note that this function should only be used to assign parent components for dialog options. Do not modify the frame.
      Returns:
      The JFrame representing the main frame of the program.

    • getToolbar

      public ToolbarView getToolbar()
      Gets the ToolbarView associated with this ProgramView.
      Returns:
      the ToolbarView associated with this ProgramView.

    • getToolbox

      public ToolboxView getToolbox()
      Gets the ToolboxView associated with this ProgramView.
      Returns:
      the ToolboxView associated with this ProgramView.

    • getGraphView

      public ChargeGraphView getGraphView()
      Gets the graph view managed by this program.
      Returns:
      the ChargeGraphView managed by this program.

    • initializeGraph

      public void initializeGraph(ChargeGraph2D model)
      Initializes the graph field of this view. Note that any existing graph will be overwritten.
      Parameters:
      model - The graph to assign to this view.

    • repaintGraph

      public void repaintGraph()
      Repaints the main graph associated with this view

    • getFileChooser

      public JFileChooser getFileChooser()
      Gets the file chooser associated with this view. Use this to maintain a consistent file path when requesting file selections.
      Returns:
      The JFileChooser associated with this view.

    • addGraphMouseListener

      public void addGraphMouseListener(MouseListener listener)
      Adds a mouse listener to this view's associated graph.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to add.

    • addGraphKeyBinding

      public void addGraphKeyBinding(KeyStroke input, String actionName, Action action)
      Adds a key binding to this view's associated graph. Note that binding created through this function are always active.
      Parameters:
      input - The KeyStroke to bind the action to.
      actionName - The internal name of the action.
      action - The action to execute when the binding is triggered.
